<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	Depreciation and amortization expenses for property and equipment amounted to
	&#165;8,359,907 thousand, &#165;9,280,309 thousand and &#165;9,533,541 thousand for the years ended March 31, 2014, 2015 and 2016,
	respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	The Company recorded net losses on sales or disposal of property and equipment
	of &#165;83,487 thousand, &#165;71,456 thousand and &#165;27,950 thousand for the years ended March 31, 2014, 2015 and 2016, respectively,
	in &#8220;General and administrative&#8221; expenses in the Company&#8217;s consolidated statements of income.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	The accumulated amortization for capitalized software were &yen;15,298,591 thousand
	and &yen;18,076,113 thousand for the years ended March 31, 2015 and 2016, respectively. The amortization expenses for capitalized
	software amounted to &yen;2,343,155 thousand and &yen;2,592,445 for the years ended March 31, 2015 and 2016, respectively. The
	weighted average amortization period for capitalized software is approximately 5.2 years. The estimated aggregate amortization
	expense of capitalized software for each of the next five years is as follows:
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -20PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -20PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -20PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	The Company recorded &yen;11,000 thousand of loss on impairment of the trademark right related to hi-ho in
	&ldquo;Sales and marketing&rdquo; expenses in the Company&rsquo;s consolidated statement of income for the year ended March 31,
	2016. Because of the recent decrease in revenues of hi-ho, the Company recognized that the trademark might be impaired. The carrying
	value of the trademark exceeded its fair value and the impairment loss was recognized in an amount equal to the excess of the carrying
	amount of the trademark over the fair value of the trademark. The fair value of the trademark was calculated using the relief-from-royalty
	method. The amount of loss was included in the network service and system integration business segment.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -20PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	No impairment of goodwill was recognized during the years ended March 31, 2014,
	2015 and 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	On December 1, 2014, IIJ acquired a new subsidiary, RYUKOSHA, and recorded
	goodwill of &#165;199,658 thousand. The goodwill components were mainly attributable to human resources and the goodwill was included
	in the network service and system integration business segment.
</P>

<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
</B>
</P>
<DIV DATA-TD-STATEMENT-TYPE="NOTE">
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	9.&#12288;&nbsp;&nbsp; LEASES
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	The Company enters into, in the normal course of business, various leases for
	domestic and international backbone services, office premises, network operation centers and data communications and other equipment.
	Certain leases that meet one or more of the criteria set forth in the provision of ASC 840, &#8220;Leases&#8221; have been classified
	as capital leases and the others have been classified as operating leases.
<BR>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	A portion of the Company&#8217;s sales result from multi-year lease agreements,
	under which the Company leased some network equipment to customers. The leases are classified as sale-type leases which the Company
	accounts for in accordance with ASC 840.
<BR>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
<B>
<I>
	Operating Leases&#8212;
</I>
</B>
	The Company has operating lease agreements
	with telecommunications carriers and others for the use of connectivity lines, including local access lines that customers use
	to connect to IIJ's network. The leases for domestic and international backbone connectivity are generally non-cancelable for a
	minimum one-year lease period. The Company also leases its office premises, for which refundable lease deposits are capitalized
	as guarantee deposits, certain office equipment under non-cancelable operating leases, and its network operation centers under
	non-cancelable operating leases
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: RED">
</FONT>
	which expire on various dates through the year 2023.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	Refundable guarantee deposits as of March 31, 2015 and 2016 consist of the following:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_48"></A>

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -25PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	Lease expenses related to backbone lines for the years ended March 31, 2014, 2015 and 2016 amounted to &yen;3,763,803&nbsp;thousand,
	&yen;3,743,576 thousand and &yen;3,638,063 thousand, respectively. Lease expenses for local access lines for the years ended March
	31, 2014, 2015 and 2016, which are mainly attributable to Internet connectivity services and WAN services, amounted to &yen;22,602,364&nbsp;thousand,
	&yen;21,967,587&nbsp;thousand and &yen;23,035,615 thousand, respectively. Other lease expenses for the years ended March 31, 2014,
	2015 and 2016 amounted to &yen;6,513,184&nbsp;thousand, &yen;6,988,368 thousand and &yen;6,880,307 thousand, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	The Company has subleased a part of its office premises. Lease expenses
	mentioned above have been reduced by sublease revenues totaling &#165;24,082 thousand, &#165;29,521 thousand and &#165;41,002
	thousand for the years ended March 31, 2014, 2015 and 2016, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
<BR>
<B>
<I>
	Capital Leases&#8212;
</I>
</B>
	The Company conducts its connectivity and other services by using data communications and other
	equipment leased under capital lease arrangements.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -25PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&#12288;&#12288;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	The Company sold ATM and data communications equipment procured from third party
	vendors, which amounted to &#165;799,232 thousand and &#165;2,807,592 thousand, to the leasing companies for the years ended March
	31, 2015 and 2016, respectively, and concurrently entered into capital lease arrangements to lease the equipment back, which resulted
	in total lease payments of &#165;819,680 thousand due by March 2020 and &#165;2,755,182 thousand due by April 2022, related to the
	lease contracts made in the years ended March 31, 2015 and 2016, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	The fair values of the assets upon execution of the capital lease arrangements
	and accumulated depreciation amounted to &#165;24,271,434&nbsp;thousand and &#165;16,614,912&nbsp;thousand, respectively, at March
	31, 2015 and &#165;28,328,721 thousand and &#165;18,728,508 thousand, respectively, at March 31, 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<B>

<DIV DATA-TD-STATEMENT-TYPE="NOTE">
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -25PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
<B>
	10. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;ASSET RETIREMENT OBLIGATIONS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 24.75PT">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 24.75PT">
	The asset retirement obligations are principally related to leasehold office
	premises and a data center which, at the end of the lease, the Company is contractually obligated to restore.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 24.75PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 24.75PT">
	The movements in asset retirement obligations for the years ended March 31,
	2015 and 2016 were as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 24.75PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>

	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 24.75PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV DATA-TD-STATEMENT-TYPE="NOTE">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 25PT">
<B>
	11.
</B>
</TD>
<TD>
<B>
	BORROWINGS
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -25PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	Short-term borrowings at March 31, 2015 and 2016 consisted of bank overdrafts
	that bear fixed rate interest. The weighted average rates at March 31, 2015 and 2016 were 0.568% and 0.498%, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<BR>
	Substantially all short-term bank borrowings are
	made under agreements which, as is customary in Japan, provide that under certain conditions the bank may require the
	borrower to provide collateral (or additional collateral) or a guarantor with respect to the borrowings and that the bank may
	treat any collateral, whether furnished as security for short-term or long-term loans or otherwise, as collateral for all
	indebtedness to such bank. Also, provisions of certain loan agreements grant certain rights of possession to the lenders in
	the event of default. The Company did not provide banks with any collateral for outstanding loans as of March 31, 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 28PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	The Company entered into bank overdraft agreements with certain Japanese
	banks for which the unused balance outstanding as of March 31, 2016 was &#165;10,750,000 thousand.
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -25PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -25PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -25PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -25PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<B>
</B>
</P>
<DIV DATA-TD-STATEMENT-TYPE="NOTE">
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<B>
	12. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;INCOME TAXES
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Income taxes imposed by the national, prefectural and
	municipal governments of Japan resulted in a normal statutory rate of approximately 38.3% for the year ended March 31, 2014
	and 35.9% for the year ended March 31, 2015 and 33.5% for the year ended March 31, 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Income from operations before income tax expense and equity in net income of equity method investees and income tax expense for the years ended March 31, 2014, 2015 and 2016 consist of the following components:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -25PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -25PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
</P>

	Income taxes

	&#8213;deferred:

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -25PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -25PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	IIJ and domestic subsidiaries adopted the consolidated
	tax declaration in the fiscal year ended March 31, 2009.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -25PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	On March 20, 2014, amendments to Japanese tax regulations were enacted into law. As a result, the normal
	Japanese statutory rate was reduced from 38.3% to 35.9% from the fiscal year beginning April 1, 2014. On March 31, 2015, new amendments
	to Japanese tax regulations were enacted into law. As a result, the normal Japanese statutory rate was reduced from 35.9% to 34.2%
	from the fiscal year beginning April 1, 2015. On March 31, 2016, further amendments to Japanese tax regulations were enacted into
	law. As a result, the normal Japanese statutory rate will be reduced to 31.7% from the fiscal year beginning April 1, 2016, 31.1%
	from the fiscal year beginning April 1, 2017 and 30.9% from the fiscal year beginning April 1, 2018. The effect of the changes
	in the tax rates on the balance of deferred tax assets and liabilities was an increase of income tax expense by &yen;106,487 thousand,
	&yen;51,788 thousand and &yen;23,183 thousand for the years ended March 31, 2014, 2015 and 2016, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -25PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 149 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 4PT SOLID">

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	*This item arises from transactions between IIJ and foreign subsidiaries,
	which were recorded in the different periods as a result of the difference in each company&#8217;s fiscal year-end.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	As of March 31, 2015 and 2016, the valuation allowance for deferred tax assets related principally to operating loss carryforwards, at amounts which are not considered more likely than not to be realized. The net changes in the valuation allowance for deferred tax assets were a decrease of &#165;933,623 thousand, an increase of &#165;183,813&nbsp;thousand and an increase of &#165;15,696 thousand for the years ended March 31, 2014, 2015 and 2016, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -25PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	Undistributed earnings of foreign subsidiaries that are deemed to be permanently
	invested amounted to &#165;458,233 thousand as of March 31, 2016. It is not practicable to calculate the unrecognized deferred
	tax liability on such undistributed earnings.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -25PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 20PT">
	&#8220;Others&#8221; consists of loss carryforwards of subsidiaries not subject to consolidation tax filing, which were composed
	of &yen;652,326 thousand in Japan, &yen;1,281,086 thousand in the United States of America, and &yen;990,871 thousand in other
	countries.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 20PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 20PT">
	These loss carryforwards are available to offset future taxable income, and
	will expire in the period ending March 31, 2024 in Japan and December 31, 2035 in the United States of America. The loss carryforwards
	in other countries will expire in the period ending December 31, 2020 or have an indefinite carryforward period.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 20PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 151 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 4PT SOLID">

	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	There was no unrecognized tax benefit for the years ended March 31, 2015
	and 2016. The Company does not reasonably expect that the unrecognized tax benefit will change significantly within the next
	twelve months.
</P>

	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	The Company has open tax years subject to
	examination by major tax jurisdictions from the year ended March 31, 2013 in Japan and from the year ended December 31, 2006
	in the United States of America.

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
</B>
</P>
<DIV DATA-TD-STATEMENT-TYPE="NOTE">
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	13. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;RETIREMENT AND PENSION PLANS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	IIJ and certain subsidiaries have unfunded severance benefit, noncontributory defined benefit pension and defined contribution
	plans which together cover substantially all of their employees who are not directors. The defined benefit pension plan is operated
	under the Defined Benefit Corporate Pension Law.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	The following information regarding net periodic pension cost and accrued pension cost also includes the unfunded
	severance benefit plans. Under the severance and defined benefit pension plans, all of IIJ and IIJ-Global&rsquo;s employees are
	entitled, upon retirement with 20 years or more of service, to a 10-year period of annuity payments from age 60 (or lump-sum severance
	indemnities) based on the rate of pay at the time of retirement, length of service and certain other factors. IIJ and IIJ-Global's
	employees who do not meet these conditions are entitled to lump-sum severance indemnities.
<BR>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	Net periodic pension cost for the years ended March 31, 2014, 2015 and 2016
	included the following components:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -25PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>

	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	The accumulated benefit obligation for the Company&#8217;s defined benefit
	pension plans as of March 31, 2015 and 2016 was &#165;3,323,739 thousand and &#165;4,084,419 thousand, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 20PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	The aggregate projected benefit obligation and aggregate fair value of plan assets for plans with projected
	benefit obligations in excess of plan assets were &yen;5,285,093 thousand and &yen;2,930,310 thousand, respectively, at March 31,
	2015 and &yen;6,388,110 thousand and &yen;3,193,899 thousand, respectively, at March 31, 2016, respectively. The aggregate accumulated
	benefit obligations of plans with no plan assets were &yen;90,851 thousand and &yen;104,051 thousand at March 31, 2015 and 2016,
	respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 20PT">
	&nbsp;

	The estimated net actuarial loss for the defined benefit pension plans that will be amortized from accumulated
	other comprehensive income into net periodic pension cost in the fiscal year ending March 31, 2017 is &yen;24,584 thousand.

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -25PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The Company sets the discount rate assumption annually at March 31 based on
	high-quality fixed income securities reflecting the estimated timing of benefit payments.
<BR>
<BR>
	The basis for determining the long-term rate of returns is a combination of historical returns and prospective return assumptions
	derived from pension trust funds&#8217; managing company.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 20PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

</TD>

	&nbsp;
</TD>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -25PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -25PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The Company expects to contribute &#165;334,252 thousand to its defined benefit
	pension plan in the year ending March 31, 2017.
<BR>
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The Company&rsquo;s defined contribution plan, which was established on April 1, 2009, covers substantially
	all its employees. The Company contributes 1.6% of its employees&rsquo; base salaries to the plan on a monthly basis. No employee
	contributions to the plan are allowed. Contributions to the plan were &yen;125,195 thousand, &yen;134,591 thousand and &yen;138,372&nbsp;thousand
	for the years ended March 31, 2014, 2015 and 2016, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The Company's funding policies with respect to the noncontributory plan are generally to contribute amounts
	considered tax deductible under applicable income tax regulations. Plan assets, including life insurance pooled investment portfolios,
	consist of Japanese and U.S. government bonds, other debt securities and marketable equity securities.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 20PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Life insurance pooled investment portfolios are managed by an insurance company
	and guarantee a minimum rate of return.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The Company&#8217;s investment strategy for the plan assets is to manage the
	assets in order to pay retirement benefits to plan participants from the Company over the life of the plans.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 20PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	This is accomplished by identifying and managing the exposure to various market risks, and diversifying investments
	in various asset classes based on a portfolio determined by the insurance company in order to maximize long-term rate of return,
	while considering the liquidity needs of the plans.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 20PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The plan is permitted to use derivative instruments only for the purpose of
	hedging. Both margin trading and real-estate investment are prohibited in principle.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 20PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The Company mitigates the credit risk of investments by establishing guidelines
	with the insurance company. These guidelines are monitored periodically by the Company for compliance.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 20PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The projected allocation of the plan assets managed by the insurance company is developed in consideration
	of the expected long-term investment returns for each category of the plan assets. Approximately 63.0%, 35.0%, and 2.0% of the
	plan assets excluding pooled investment portfolios will be allocated to debt securities, equity securities and other financial
	instruments, respectively, to moderate the level of volatility in pension plan asset returns and reduce risks. 50% of the employer&rsquo;s
	contribution to the plan during the year ending March 31, 2017 will be allocated to life insurance pooled investment portfolios
	and the other 50% will be allocated to the aforementioned investments.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 20PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 156 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 4PT SOLID">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 33%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 34%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	F-
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	36
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->
</TD>

	&nbsp;

<A NAME="eolPage157"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The following table summarizes the basis used to measure the Company&#8217;s
	pension plan assets at fair value:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 20PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	Level 1&#8212;Inputs are quoted prices in active markets for identical assets
	or liabilities.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -40PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 65PT">
	Level 2&#8212;Inputs are quoted prices for similar assets
	or liabilities in active markets, quoted prices for identical or similar assets or liabilities in markets that are not active,
	inputs other than quoted prices that are
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 65PT">
	observable, and inputs that are derived principally from or corroborated by
	observable market data by correlation or other means.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -40PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 65PT">
	Level 3&#8212;Inputs are derived from valuation techniques
	in which one or more significant inputs or value drivers are unobservable, which reflect the reporting entity&#8217;s own assumptions
	about the assumptions that market participants would use in establishing a price.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 20PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 20PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>

	&nbsp;
</TD>

	&nbsp;

	&nbsp;

<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; BACKGROUND-COLOR: RGB(204,238,255)">
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 2.25PT">
	Total assets at fair value
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 2.25PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 2.25PT DOUBLE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#165;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 2.25PT DOUBLE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
	809,550
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 2.25PT DOUBLE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 2.25PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 2.25PT DOUBLE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#165;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 2.25PT DOUBLE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
	2,384,349
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 2.25PT DOUBLE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 2.25PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 2.25PT DOUBLE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 2.25PT DOUBLE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#8211;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 2.25PT DOUBLE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 2.25PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 2.25PT DOUBLE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&#165;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 2.25PT DOUBLE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
	3,193,899
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 2.25PT DOUBLE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	* Other financial instruments are life insurance pooled investment
	portfolios.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -25PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Pension plan assets classified as Level 1 are comprised
	principally of equity securities, which are valued using an unadjusted quoted market price in active markets with sufficient
	volume and frequency of transactions.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -25PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Pension plan assets classified as Level 2 are comprised principally of government
	bonds, corporate bonds and life insurance pooled investment portfolios which are valued based on quoted prices obtained from a
	well-established third-party. The bonds are traded in less active markets and the fair values are based on the price a dealer
	would pay for the bonds.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 20PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	IIJ and one subsidiary also participate in a contributory multi-employer pension plan, the Japan Computer
	Information Service Employee's Pension Fund (the &quot;Multi-Employer Plan&quot;), which covers substantially all of their employees.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<BR>
	As stipulated by the Japanese Welfare Pension Insurance Law, the Multi-Employer Plan is composed of a substitutional portion of
	Japanese Pension Insurance and a multi-employers' portion of a contributory defined benefit pension plan. The benefits for the
	substitutional portion are based on a standard remuneration schedule under the Welfare Pension Insurance Law and the length of
	participation. The multi-employer portion of the benefits is based on the employee's length of service. However, assets contributed
	by an employer including IIJ are not segregated in a separate account or restricted to provide benefits only to employees of that
	employer. The net pension cost under the Multi-Employer Plan is recognized when contributions become due.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 20PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Contributions due and paid during the years ended March
	31, 2014, 2015 and 2016 under the Multi-Employer Plan, including its substitutional portion, amounted to
	&#165;265,470&nbsp;thousand, &#165;293,132 thousand and &#165;123,674 thousand, respectively. The Company&#8217;s contribution
	did not represent more than 5% of total contributions to the plan during the years ended March 31, 2014, 2015 and 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 20PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The plan is not subject to a funding improvement and was more than 80% funded as of March 31, 2015. The total
	plan assets were &yen;307,788,655&nbsp;thousand as of March 31, 2016. It was not practical to obtain additional information for
	the plan for the year ended March 31, 2016.
<BR>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 158 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 4PT SOLID">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 33%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 34%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	F-
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	38
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 33%; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage159"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The amount of retirement benefits for retiring directors and company auditors must be approved by the shareholders.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 20PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	IIJ has a retirement plan for full-time company auditors. The Company recorded
	a liability for retirement benefit for company auditors of &#165;5,530 thousand and &#165;7,530 thousand, which would be required
	if they were all to retire at March 31, 2015 and 2016, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 20PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	IIJ had a retirement benefit plan for full-time directors, which was abolished in June 2011. The allowance
	for retirement benefit amounted to &yen;255,330 thousand in consideration of their services provided up to the date of abolition
	of the plan, and this amount will be reserved until each director&rsquo;s retirement date. IIJ&rsquo;s subsidiary also has a retirement
	benefit plan for full-time directors. The Company recorded a liability for retirement benefit for full-time directors of &yen;430,638
	thousand and &yen;379,685 thousand, which would be required if they were all to retire at March 31, 2015 and 2016, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 20PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	The retirement benefits paid to a retired company auditor was &yen;2,010 thousand for the year ended March
	31, 2014.
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 20PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 159 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 4PT SOLID">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 33%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 34%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	F-
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	39
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 33%; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&nbsp;

<A NAME="eolPage160"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV DATA-TD-STATEMENT-TYPE="NOTE">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 25PT">
<B>
	14.
</B>
</TD>
<TD>
<B>
	SHAREHOLDERS' EQUITY
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	Japanese companies are subject to the Corporation Law of Japan (the &#8220;Corporation
	Law&#8221;). The significant provisions in the Corporation Law that affect financial and accounting matters are summarized below:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
<B>
<I>
	Dividends
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	Under the Corporation Law, companies can pay dividends at any time during the
	fiscal year in addition to the year-end dividend upon resolution at the shareholders meeting. For companies that meet certain criteria
	such as: (1) having a Board of Directors, (2) having independent auditors, (3) having a Board of Company Auditors, and (4) the
	term of service of the directors is prescribed as one year rather than two years of normal term by its articles of incorporation,
	the Board of Directors may declare dividends (except for dividends in kind) at any time during the fiscal year if the company has
	prescribed so in its articles of incorporation. However, the Company cannot do so because it does not meet criteria (4) above.
	The Corporation Law permits companies to distribute dividends-in-kind (non-cash assets) to shareholders subject to a certain limitation
	and additional requirements. Semiannual interim dividends may also be paid once a year upon resolution by the Board of Directors
	if the articles of incorporation of the company so stipulate. The Corporation Law provides certain limitations on the amounts available
	for dividends or the purchase of treasury stock. The limitation is defined as the amount available for distribution to the shareholders,
	but the amount of net assets after dividends must be maintained at no less than &#165;3 million.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	At the 14
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	th
</FONT>
	Ordinary General Shareholders
	Meeting held on June 28, 2006, IIJ&#8217;s shareholders approved the reductions of additional paid-in capital of &#165;21,980,395
	thousand and common stock of &#165;2,539,222 thousand to eliminate the accumulated deficit for the purpose of reporting under the
	Corporation Law in its non-consolidated financial statements. The effective date was August 4, 2006.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
<B>
<I>
	Increases / decreases and transfer of common stock, reserve and surplus
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	The Corporation Law requires that an amount equal to 10% of dividends must be
	appropriated as legal reserve (a component of retained earnings) or as additional paid-in capital (a component of capital surplus)
	depending on the equity account charged upon the payment of such dividends until the total of aggregate amount of legal reserve
	and additional paid-in capital equals 25% of common stock. Under the Corporation Law, the total amount of additional paid-in capital
	and legal reserve may be reversed without limitation. The Corporation Law also provides that common stock, legal reserve, additional
	paid-in capital, and other capital surplus and retained earnings can be transferred among the accounts under certain conditions
	upon resolution of shareholders.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
<B>
<I>
	Treasury stock and treasury stock acquisition rights
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	The Corporation Law also provides for companies to purchase treasury stock and
	dispose of such treasury stock by resolution of the Board of Directors. The amount of treasury stock purchased cannot exceed the
	amount available for distribution to the shareholders which is determined by a specific formula.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	The Corporation Law also provides that companies can purchase both treasury
	stock acquisition rights and treasury stock.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	The amount of retained earnings available for dividends under the Corporation Law is based on the amount of
	retained earnings recorded in IIJ&rsquo;s general books of account prepared using accepted Japanese accounting practices. The adjustments
	included in the accompanying consolidated financial statements for U.S. GAAP purposes but not recorded in the general books of
	account have no effect on the determination of retained earnings available for dividends under the Corporation Law. Retained earnings
	available for dividends amounted to &yen;24,895,644 thousand at March 31, 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
<B>
<I>
	&nbsp;
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	IIJ's equity in undistributed earnings of affiliated companies accounted for
	by the equity method included in retained earnings amounted to &#165;869,770 thousand at March 31, 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
<B>
<I>
	&nbsp;
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
<B>
<I>
</I>
</B>
	In July 2013, IIJ completed a public offering of 4,700,000
	new shares of common stock by a firm-commitment underwriting at an issue price of &#165;3,346 (an amount paid of &#165;3,208) per
	share on the Tokyo Stock Exchange. In August 2013, IIJ issued 700,000 new shares of common stock by way of Third-Party Allotment
	at an amount paid of &#165;3,208 per share. Stock issuance costs of &#165;51,996 thousand (net of tax) were deducted from additional
	paid-in-capital. The total of net proceeds to IIJ from the public offering and the third-party allotment, after deducting stock
	issuance costs, were &#165;17,271,204 thousand.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 25PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	On June 26, 2013, IIJ&rsquo;s shareholders approved the payment of a cash dividend to shareholders of record
	at March 31, 2013 of &yen;10 per share or the aggregate amount of &yen;405,368 thousand.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 160 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 4PT SOLID">

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 33%">
	&nbsp;

<A NAME="eolPage161"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	On November 8, 2013, the Board of Directors of IIJ resolved the payment of a cash dividend to shareholders
	of record at September 30, 2013 of &yen;11 per share or the aggregate amount of &yen;505,329 thousand.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	On June 25, 2014, IIJ&rsquo;s shareholders approved the payment of a cash dividend to shareholders of record
	at March 31, 2014 of &yen;11 per share or the aggregate amount of &yen;505,330 thousand.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	On November 7, 2014, the Board of Directors of IIJ resolved the payment of a cash dividend to shareholders
	of record at September 30, 2014 of &yen;11 per share or the aggregate amount of &yen;505,365 thousand.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	On June 26, 2015, IIJ&rsquo;s shareholders approved the payment of a cash dividend
	to shareholders of record at March 31, 2015 of &yen;11 per share or the aggregate amount of &yen;505,365 thousand.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	On November 9, 2015, the Board of Directors of IIJ resolved the payment of a cash dividend to shareholders
	of record at September 30, 2015 of &yen;11 per share or the aggregate amount of &yen;505,479 thousand.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
<I>
	&nbsp;
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
<B>
<I>
	Stock Option Plans
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	On May 26, 2011, IIJ&#8217;s board of
	directors resolved to introduce stock compensation-type stock options for executive officers of IIJ. On June 28, 2011, IIJ&#8217;s
	ordinary general meeting of shareholders approved the introduction of stock compensation-type stock options for directors of IIJ.
	Stock compensation-type stock options, which are stock acquisition rights entitling holders to acquire shares upon exercise, at
	an exercise price of one yen per share, were allocated to directors and executive officers as a substitute for the retirement
	allowance plan for them and to further promote their motivation and incentives to contribute to the enhancement of the mid- to
	long-term continuous business performance and corporate value.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -25PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	The stock acquisition rights become exercisable after a
	service period of one year and are exercisable up to 29 years from the date of vesting. The stock acquisition rights may be exercised
	only within 10 days from the day immediately following the day on which the person loses his or her position as either a director
	or an executive officer.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -25PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	On July 11, 2013, IIJ granted 89 stock options which were the same type of options
	granted in 2012 to directors and executive officers. The fair value per option at the date of grant was &#165;647,000.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	On July 10, 2014, IIJ granted 128 stock options which were the same type of
	options granted in 2013 to directors and executive officers. The fair value per option at the date of grant was &#165;422,600.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	On July 13, 2015, IIJ granted 151 stock options which were the same type of
	options granted in 2014 to directors and executive officers. The fair value per option at the date of grant was &#165;369,200.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	The fair value of the stock acquisition rights used to recognize compensation expense for the fiscal years
	ended March 31, 2014, 2015 and 2016 were estimated using the Black-Scholes option-pricing model with the following assumptions:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -25PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
<B>
</B>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -25PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -25PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	The Company recognized stock compensation cost on a straight-line
	basis over the requisite service period.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	The Company recognized &yen;53,542 thousand, &yen;54,965 thousand and &yen;55,337 thousand as stock compensation
	cost for the fiscal years ended March 31, 2014, 2015 and 2016, respectively. The unrecognized expense of &yen;13,937 thousand is
	expected to be recognized over the next 3 months.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	IIJ absorbed IIJ-Exlayer on January 1, 2014 with the allotment of 104 shares
	of IIJ&#8217;s treasury stock to the shareholders of IIJ-Exlayer.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
<B>
<I>
	Net income attributable to IIJ&#8217;s shareholders and transfers from
	the noncontrolling interests
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	The following schedule represents the effects of changes in IIJ&#8217;s ownership
	interest in its subsidiaries in the Company&#8217;s shareholder&#8217;s equity for the years ended March 31, 2014, 2015 and 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -40PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 40PT">

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 25PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>

<DIV DATA-TD-STATEMENT-TYPE="NOTE">
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	17.&#12288;&nbsp;&nbsp;COMMITMENTS AND CONTINGENT LIABILITIES
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0.2PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	The Company is involved in litigation and claims arising
	in the ordinary course of business. In evaluating the matter on an ongoing basis, the Company takes into account amounts already
	accrued on the balance sheet. The Company believes that an exposure to loss does not exist in excess of the amount accrued and
	the negative adverse outcome of such litigation and claims would not have a significant impact on the consolidated financial position
	or results of operations.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0.2PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.35IN">
	On September 1, 2010, IIJ-Global entered into a Solutions
	Engagement Agreement with IBM Japan Ltd, IIJ-Global&#8217;s largest sales partner. This agreement, which establishes the basis
	for a procurement relationship between IIJ-Global and IBM Japan, contains indemnification for IIJ-Global to perform services, functions,
	responsibilities and others in a way that were being performed by AT&amp;T Japan.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.35IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.35IN">
	In May 2006, January 2007, January 2008 and January 2015,
	IIJ made agreements (four agreements in total) for investing in funds which invest in mainly unlisted stocks with an investment
	advisory company. IIJ committed to provide up to $5,000 thousand for each fund ($20,000 thousand in total) upon the request of
	the fund until January 31, 2027. IIJ has provided a total of $14,093 thousand to them as of March 31, 2016. The amounts invested
	in their funds were recorded as other investments in the Company&#8217;s consolidated balance sheets.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.35IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	In April 2013, IIJ made an agreement for investing in a corporation
	reconstruction fund with an investment advisory company. IIJ committed to provide up to &#165;100,000 thousand upon the request
	of the fund until April 23, 2018. IIJ has provided a total of &#165;87,404 thousand to the fund as of March 31, 2016. The amounts
	invested in the fund were recorded as other investments in the Company&#8217;s consolidated balance sheets.
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
</B>
</P>
<DIV DATA-TD-STATEMENT-TYPE="NOTE">
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	18
<I>
	.
</I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;FINANCIAL INSTRUMENTS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -25PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
<B>
<I>
	&nbsp;
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0.2PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
<B>
<I>
	Fair Value&#8212;
</I>
</B>
	In the normal course of business,
	the Company invests in financial assets. To estimate the fair value of those financial assets, the Company uses quoted market prices
	to the extent that they are available. Where a quoted market price is not available, the Company estimates fair value using primarily
	the discounted cash flow method. For certain financial assets and liabilities, such as trade receivables and trade payables, which
	are expected to be collected and settled within one year, the Company assumes that the carrying amount approximates fair value
	due to their short maturities. Investments for which it is not practicable to estimate fair value primarily consist of investments
	in a number of unaffiliated and unlisted smaller sized companies and the estimate of their fair values cannot be made without incurring
	excessive costs. Refundable insurance policies are carried at cash surrender value. The carrying amounts and fair value of financial
	instruments are summarized below:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -25PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	Cash and cash equivalents were classified as Level 1 instruments and short-term
	borrowings were classified as Level 2 instruments.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 26.3PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	Other investments for which it is practicable to estimate fair value are available-for-sales
	equity and debt securities disclosed in Note 4.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 26.3PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	Other investments for which it is not practicable to estimate fair value were
	comprised of non-marketable equity securities of &#165;853,629 thousand and investments in funds of &#165;1,492,596 thousand as of
	March 31, 2015 and non-marketable equity securities of &#165;1,019,685 thousand and investments in funds of &#165;984,659 thousand
	as of March 31, 2016.
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -25PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -25PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
<B>
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -25PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
<B>
</B>
</P>
<DIV DATA-TD-STATEMENT-TYPE="NOTE">
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -25PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
<B>
	19.&#12288;&nbsp;&nbsp;FAIR VALUE MEASUREMENTS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -25PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	ASC 820, &#8220;Fair Value Measurement&#8221; defines fair
	value as the price that would be received to sell an asset or paid to transfer a liability (an exit price) in the principal or
	most advantageous market for the asset or liability in an orderly transaction between market participants at the measurement date.
	ASC 820 establishes a three-level fair value hierarchy that prioritizes the inputs used to measure fair value as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -25PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -40PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 65PT">
	Level 1&#8212;Inputs are quoted prices in active markets for identical assets or liabilities.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -40PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 65PT">
	Level 2&#8212;Inputs are quoted prices for similar assets
	or liabilities in active markets, quoted prices for identical or similar assets or liabilities in markets that are not active,
	inputs other than quoted prices that are observable, and inputs that are derived principally from or corroborated by observable
	market data by correlation or other means.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -40PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 65PT">
	Level 3&#8212;Inputs are derived from valuation techniques
	in which one or more significant inputs or value drivers are unobservable, which reflect the reporting entity&#8217;s own assumptions
	about the assumptions that market participants would use in establishing a price.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -40PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 65PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -40PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 65PT">
	There were no transfers between Level 1 and Level 2 for
	the years ended March 31, 2015 and 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -40PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 65PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
<B>
<I>
	Assets Measured at Fair Value on a Recurring Basis
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -25PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	The following table presents the Company&rsquo;s assets that are measured at fair value on a recurring basis
	at March 31, 2015 and 2016, consistent with the fair value hierarchy provisions of ASC 820.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -25PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 167 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 4PT SOLID">

<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 33%">
	&nbsp;

	F-
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	47

<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 1.1PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD COLSPAN="15" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1.1PT SOLID">
	Thousands of&nbsp;&nbsp;Yen
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<U>
	March 31, 2015
</U>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 1.1PT">
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -25PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -25PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	Available-for-sale securities are comprised of marketable
	equity and debt securities. Marketable equity securities are listed on Japan and Hong Kong securities markets and are valued using
	an unadjusted quoted market price in active markets with sufficient volume and frequency of transactions. Marketable debt securities
	are valued using quoted prices obtained from financial institutions.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -25PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<B>
<I>
	Assets Measured at Fair Value on a Nonrecurring Basis
</I>
</B>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -25PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -25PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -25PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -25PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	Non-marketable equity securities with a carrying amount of &yen;31,552 thousand, which was included in other investments
	in the balance sheets, were written down to the fair value of &yen;2,435 thousand, resulting in an other-than-temporary impairment
	charge of &yen;29,117 thousand, which was included in the Company&rsquo;s statement of income for the year ended March 31, 2015.
	Non-marketable equity securities with a carrying amount of &yen;11,000 thousand, which was included in other investments in the
	balance sheets, were written down to the fair value of &yen;235 thousand, resulting in an other-than-temporary impairment charge
	of &yen;10,765 thousand, which was included in the Company&rsquo;s statement of income for the year ended March 31, 2016. The Company
	used unobservable inputs to value the impairment of these non-marketable Level 3 investments. The fair value was determined as
	a result of considering various unobservable inputs, including expectation of future income of the investees, net asset value of
	the investees, and material unrealized losses to be considered in assets and liabilities held by the investees.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 168 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 4PT SOLID">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 33%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 34%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	F-
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	48
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 33%; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>

<A NAME="eolPage169"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	The trademark right related to hi-ho with a carrying
	amount of &#165;107,000 thousand was written down to a fair value of &#165;96,000 thousand, resulting in an impairment charge
	of &#165;11,000 thousand, which was included in the Company&#8217;s statement of income for the year ended March 31, 2016. The
	impaired trademark was classified within Level 3 as the Company used unobservable inputs such as expected future income to
	value the trademark.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -40PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 65PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -0.9PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25.9PT">
	Level 3 valuations are determined by the Company&rsquo;s valuation team (accounting and financing managers)
	based on the methodologies used to perform the valuation of each instrument. The Company uses third-party valuation firms to conduct
	the valuation of certain instruments, if necessary. Detailed reviews of the methodologies in valuations and the reasonableness
	of the valuations (including those performed by third parties) are performed by the chief financial officer.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -0.9PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25.9PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	The following table presents information relating to the
	significant unobservable inputs of the Company&#8217;s Level 3 non-recurring measurements.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
</P>

	Thousands of Yen
</TD>

</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 1.1PT">

</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; PADDING-BOTTOM: 1.1PT">
	&nbsp;

<B>
	BUSINESS SEGMENTS

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	The operating segments reported below are those for which segment-specific financial information is available.
	Accounting policies used to determine segment profit or loss and segment assets are consistent with those used to prepare the consolidated
	financial statements in accordance with U.S. GAAP. The Company&rsquo;s chief operating decision maker uses this financial information
	to make decisions on the allocation of resources and to evaluate business performance.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	The Network service and systems integration business segment comprises revenues
	from network services, systems integration and equipment sales.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	The ATM operation business segment comprises revenues from the ATM operation
	business.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<DIV DATA-TD-STATEMENT-TYPE="NOTE">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 25PT">
<B>
	22.
</B>
</TD>
<TD>
<B>
	RELATED PARTY TRANSACTIONS
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -25PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	NTT and its subsidiaries own 26.0% of IIJ's outstanding common shares and 26.4%
	of IIJ's voting shares as of March 31, 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
<BR>
	The Company entered into a number of different types of transactions with NTT and its subsidiaries including purchases of wireline
	telecommunication services for the Company&#8217;s offices and capital lease arrangements. For the Company&#8217;s connectivity
	and outsourcing services, the Company purchases international and domestic backbone services, local access lines and rental rack
	space in data centers and mobile data communication services from NTT and its subsidiaries. The Company sells to NTT and its subsidiaries
	its services, system integration services and monitoring services for their data centers.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -25PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">

	Company with NTT and its subsidiaries for the each of the three years in the period ended March 31, 2016, are summarized as follows:

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -25PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -25PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV DATA-TD-STATEMENT-TYPE="NOTE">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 25PT">
<B>
	23.
</B>
</TD>
<TD>
<B>
	SUBSEQUENT EVENTS
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: -25PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	On June 24, 2016, IIJ&rsquo;s shareholders approved the payment of a cash dividend to shareholders of record
	at March 31, 2016 of &yen;11 per share or &yen;505,480 thousand in the aggregate.
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 25PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	*&nbsp;*&nbsp;*&nbsp;*&nbsp;*&nbsp;*
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0">
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0">
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
	F-51
</P>
</EFX_NOTES_TO_FINANCIAL_STATEMENT>

</P>

<DIV ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 3PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT">

	&nbsp;
