<DIV CLASS="eolNewPage"></DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage172"></A>
<A NAME="EXH_14_HTM"></A>
<EFX_EXHIBIT_1>
<A NAME="FIS_EXHIBIT_1"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	Exhibit 1.4
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	(English Translation)
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
<U>
	REGULATIONS OF THE BOARD OF STATUTORY AUDITORS
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 297.85PT">
	Enacted on September 1, 1995
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; TEXT-INDENT: 42.55PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 255.3PT">
	Amended on May 21, 2015
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Article 1.&#9;(Purpose)
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	These Regulations aim at the proper and smooth
	operation of the Board of Statutory Auditors of the Company in accordance with laws and rules of Japan and the Articles of Incorporation,
	and conforming to the relevant regulations of the Securities and Exchange Commission of the United States (&quot;SEC&quot;).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Article 2.&#9;(Organization)
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 42.75PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21PT">
	1.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Board of Statutory Auditors shall be organized by all the statutory auditors.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 42.75PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21PT">
	2.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Board of Statutory Auditors shall appoint full-time auditors.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Article 3.&#9;(Purpose of the Board of Statutory Auditors)
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.2PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT">
	The Board of Statutory Auditors
	shall receive reports on, deliberate regarding and resolve important matters regarding audits; provided, however, that the Board
	of Statutory Auditors may not preclude any auditors from exercising his/her own powers.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Article 4.&#9;(Duties of the Board of Statutory Auditors)
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.2PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT">
	The Board of Statutory Auditors
	shall, among other things, perform the following duties; provided, however, that the determination made under item (iii) of
	this Article may not preclude any auditors from exercising his/her own powers:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.2PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT">
</P>
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; WIDTH: 12%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	i.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 1%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: MIDDLE; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: 87%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	preparation
	of audit reports,
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	ii.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: MIDDLE; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	appointment and removal
	of full-time auditors, and&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	iii.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: MIDDLE; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	determination of audit
	policies, the methods of investigation of the status of the operations and the financial status of the Company and other matters
	regarding the performance of the auditors&rsquo; duties.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.2PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Article 5.&#9;(Appointment and Removal of Full-time Auditors)
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	The Board of Statutory Auditors shall, by resolution,
	appoint or remove full-time auditors from among auditors.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Article 6.&#9;(Chairperson)
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 42.55PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
	1.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The chairperson of the Board of Statutory Auditors shall be a full-time auditor. When there is
	more than one full-time auditors, the chairperson of the Board of Statutory Auditors shall be elected by voting among statutory
	auditors.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 42.55PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
	2.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The chairperson shall convene and preside over meetings of the Board of Statutory Auditors and
	perform other duties entrusted to the chairperson by the Board of Statutory Auditors; provided, however, that the chairperson may
	not preclude any auditors from exercising his/her own powers.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 1 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 4PT SOLID">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage173"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Article 7. (Specified Auditors)
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 42.55PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
	1.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Board of Statutory Auditors shall by resolution appoint the person hereinafter referred to
	as the &ldquo;specified auditors&rdquo; to perform the following duties:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -106.1PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 106.1PT">
</P>
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; WIDTH: 12%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	i.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; WIDTH: 1%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: MIDDLE; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: 87%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	to receive from the directors
	the business reports, the annexed specifications thereof and accounting-related documents to be received by each auditors,
	and distribute these documents to the other auditors,&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	ii.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: MIDDLE; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	to provide notice of the contents of the
	Board of Statutory Auditors audit report concerning the business reports and the annexed specifications thereof to the directors
	hereinafter referred to as &ldquo;specified directors&rdquo; determined to be the persons to receive such notice,&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	iii.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: MIDDLE; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	to agree with the specified directors on
	the date to provide the notice mentioned in the preceding item,&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	iv.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: MIDDLE; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	to receive notice of the contents of the
	accounting audit report from the independent account auditors and provide notice of the contents of such audit report to the
	other auditors,&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	v.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: MIDDLE; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	to agree with the specified directors and
	the independent account auditors on the date to receive the notice mentioned in the preceding item,&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	vi.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: MIDDLE; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	to provide notice of the contents of the
	Board of Statutory Auditors audit report concerning the accounting-related documents to the specified directors and the independent
	account auditors, and&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	vii.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: MIDDLE; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	to agree with the specified directors on
	the date to provide the notice mentioned in the preceding item.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -106.1PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 106.1PT">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -106.1PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 106.1PT">
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 42.7PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.15PT">
	2.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Specified auditors shall be full-time auditors.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -21.15PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 63.85PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Article 8. (Holdings of Meetings)
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT">
	The Meetings of the Board of Statutory Auditors shall
	in principal be held once every month; provided, however, extraordinary Meetings of the Board of Statutory Auditors may be held
	whenever necessary.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Article 9. (Convening Meetings)
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.2PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT">
	The Meetings of the Board of Statutory
	Auditors which is held monthly as mentioned in the previous Article shall be convened and presided over by the chairperson. However,
	any auditors who make demand to convene the Meeting of the Board of Statutory Auditors may convene and preside over a meeting of
	the Board of Statutory Auditors on his/her own.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Article 10.&#9;(Convocation Procedures)
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 42.6PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
	1.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	A notice of the convocation of the Meeting of the Board of Statutory Auditors shall be dispatched
	to each auditors at least three days prior to the date set for each Meeting; provided, however, that this period may be shortened
	in case of urgent need.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 42.6PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
	2.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Meeting of the Board of Statutory Auditors may be held without the convocation procedures upon
	the unanimous consent of all auditors.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Article 11.&#9;(Method of Resolution)
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 42.55PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
	1.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	A resolution by the Board of Statutory Auditors shall be made by a majority vote of all of the
	auditors, except as otherwise provided by rules and laws.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 42.55PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
	2.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Any resolution shall be made by deliberation based on thorough information.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 2 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 4PT SOLID">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage174"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Article 12.&#9;(Resolution on Audit Politics, etc.)
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 42.55PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
	1.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Audit policies, audit plans, methods of audit, allotment of audit duties among auditors and other
	related matters shall be determined by the Board of Statutory Auditors resolutions.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 42.55PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
	2.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	In addition to those set forth in the preceding paragraph, the Board of Statutory Auditors shall
	resolve the matters it determines necessary for the performance of its functions, such as appointment of staffs for the Board of
	Statutory Auditors Administration office, which include cases when independent counsel such as outside attorney, independent account
	firm, and other advisers necessary to carry out duties of the Board of Statutory Auditors, and a budget for audit expense, which
	includes appointment for staffs for auditors.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 42.55PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
	3.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Board of Statutory Auditors shall request that the directors resolve the contents of the following
	audit systems and develop such systems:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -127.95PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 127.95PT">
</P>

</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: MIDDLE; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	systems to report to auditors and any
	other systems relating to reports to be provided to auditors,
</FONT>
</TD>

</TD>

	(1)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">

</TD>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

	to take place onto the person who reports concerns received from subsidiaries&rsquo; directors, auditors, and employees to
	auditors as mentioned in a previous item,
</FONT>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

	how to process expenses or debt such as prepaid expenses or procedure or redemption which resulted from executing the duties

<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	any other systems for ensuring the effectiveness
	of auditors&rsquo; audit activities.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -127.95PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 127.95PT">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Article 13.&#9;(Regular Meetings, etc. with the Representative Directors)
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 42.55PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
	1.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Board of Statutory Auditors shall hold meetings with the representative directors on a regular
	basis and shall endeavor to deepen their mutual understanding with the representative directors by, for example, exchanging opinions
	with the representative directors regarding issues to be addressed by the Company, the status of the development of the environment
	for auditors&rsquo; audits, important issues regarding audits, and any other relevant matters, and by making requests as necessary.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 42.55PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
	2.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Board of Statutory Auditors shall explain its audit policies, audit plan, the status of audits
	and the results of audits to the representative directors and the board of directors.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 42.55PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
	3.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	In addition to the requirement set forth in applicable law, the Board of Statutory Auditors shall
	determine the matters that directors and employees should report to the Board of Statutory Auditors on consultation with the directors
	and shall receive reports.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_AUDITORS_OPINION>
<A NAME="FIS_AUDITORS_OPINION_3"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Article 14.&#9;(Reports to the Board of Auditors)
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 42.55PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
	1.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Auditors shall report the status of the performance of their own duties to the Board of Statutory
	Auditors on a regular basis and whenever the Board of Statutory Auditors requests a report.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 42.55PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
	2.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Auditors who received a report from the independent account auditor, the directors, employees of
	the Company&rsquo;s internal division and other relevant departments, and other relevant persons shall report to the Board of Statutory
	Auditors.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 3 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 4PT SOLID">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage175"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 42.55PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
	3.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Board of Statutory Auditors shall request the independent account auditors, the directors,
	the internal auditors and other relevant departments and persons to attend the meetings and provide reports as necessary.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_AUDITORS_OPINION>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_AUDITORS_OPINION>
<A NAME="FIS_AUDITORS_OPINION_4"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Article 15.&#9;(Omitting Reports to the Board of Statutory Auditors)
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.2PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT">
	If auditors, the independent account
	auditors, the directors, employees of the Company&rsquo;s internal audit division and other relevant department, and other relevant
	persons provide notice of the matters to be reported to the Board of Statutory Auditors to all statutory auditor, such matters
	shall not be required to be reported to the Board of Statutory Auditors. However, this Article shall not prelude the Board of Statutory
	Auditors from making a request to receive a report from the independent account auditors, the directors, employees of the Company&rsquo;s
	internal audit division and other relevant department, and other relevant person if such request is made reasonably.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Article 16.&#9;(Measures for Report)
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT">
	The Board of Statutory Auditors shall undertake necessary
	investigations and take measures appropriate to the situation upon the receipt of the following reports:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT">
</P>
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; WIDTH: 12%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	i.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; WIDTH: 1%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: MIDDLE; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: 87%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	reports from the directors
	that any fact likely to cause the Company significant damage has been found,
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	ii.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: MIDDLE; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	reports from the independent account
	auditors that, in connection with the directors&rsquo; performance of their duties, any misconduct or any material fact constituting
	a violation of any law or regulation or the articles of incorporation has been found, or&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	iii.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: MIDDLE; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	reports from the directors or employees
	on the matters determined in prior deliberation with the directors.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Article 17. &#9;(Preparation of Audit Report)
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 42.55PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
	1.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Board of Statutory Auditors
<I>
</I>
	shall prepare audit reports through deliberations based
	on the audit report prepared by each auditors
<I>
	,
</I>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 42.55PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
	2.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Board of Statutory Auditors shall receive accounting documents from the directors and audit
	reports from the independent account auditors.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 42.55PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
	3.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	In cases where the contents of the Board of Statutory Auditors audit report are different from
	the contents of any of the Board of Statutory Auditors audit report and at the request of such auditors, the Board of Statutory
	Auditors shall append a note with the contents of such Board of Statutory Auditors audit report to the Board of Statutory Auditors
	audit report.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 42.55PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
	4.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Each auditors shall affix to the Board of Statutory Auditors audit report his/her respective signature,
	or his/her respective name and seal impression (including electronic signature). Full-time auditors and outside auditors shall
	describe their positions as full-time auditors or outside auditors in the Board of Statutory Auditors audit report.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 42.55PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.25PT">
	5.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The provisions of the preceding four paragraphs shall apply mutatis mutandis to audit reports to
	be prepared when extraordinary accounting documents or consolidated accounting documents are prepared by the Company
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Article 18. &#9;(Consent, etc. regarding the Election of Auditors)
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT">
	The following matters regarding the election of auditors
	shall be determined by the Board of Statutory Auditors&rsquo; resolution:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT">
</P>
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; WIDTH: 12%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	i.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; WIDTH: 1%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: MIDDLE; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: 87%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	consent to submit to the
	shareholders&rsquo; meeting a proposal concerning the election of auditors by the directors,&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE">

<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; WIDTH: 1%">

</FONT>

	demand to submit to the shareholders&rsquo;
	meeting a proposal concerning the election of auditors.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT">

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT">

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Article 19. (Resolutions, etc. regarding the Election of Independent
	Account Auditors)
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 42.75PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21PT">
	1.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The following matters regarding the election, dismissal or disapproval of reappointment of independent
	account auditors shall be determined by the Board of Statutory Auditors&rsquo; resolution:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -127.1PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 127.1PT">
</P>
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; WIDTH: 12%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	i.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; WIDTH: 1%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: MIDDLE; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: 87%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	to establish policies regarding
	the dismissal or disapproval of the independent account auditors,
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	ii.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: MIDDLE; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	to make appropriate decisions regarding
	reappointment of the independent account auditors,
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	iii.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: MIDDLE; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	to submit a proposal concerning dismissal
	or disapproval of the independent account auditors to the shareholders&rsquo; meetings,&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	iv.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: MIDDLE; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	to submit a proposal concerning the
	election of the independent account auditors to the shareholders&rsquo; meetings, and&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	v.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: MIDDLE; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	to elect a person who is to temporarily
	perform the duties of the independent account auditors in case of the vacancy of the independent account auditors.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -127.1PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 127.1PT">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -127.1PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 127.1PT">
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 42.75PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21PT">
	2.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The unanimous consent of all auditors is required for the dismissal of the independent account
	auditors based on the statutory grounds of dismissal and may be obtained through deliberations of the Board of Statutory Auditors.
	In such case, auditors selected by the Board of Statutory Auditors shall report the dismissal and the reason thereof at the first
	shareholders&rsquo; meeting to be held after the dismissal.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 42.75PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21PT">
	3.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The consent mentioned in the preceding paragraphs may be made in writing or by electronic means
	in case of urgent necessity.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 42.55PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Article 20.&#9;(Consent to Remuneration, etc. of the Independent
	Account Auditors)
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT">
	The consent to remuneration, etc. of the independent
	account auditors or a person to temporarily perform the duties of the independent account auditors shall be determined by the Board
	of Statutory Auditors&rsquo; resolution.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Article 21.&#9;(Consent to Partial Exemption of Directors from Liability)
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 42.75PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21PT">
	1.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The unanimous consent of all auditors is required for the following consents through deliberation
	of the Board of Statutory Auditors.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -127.6PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 127.6PT">
</P>
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; WIDTH: 12%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	i.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; WIDTH: 1%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: MIDDLE; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: 87%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	consent to submit to the
	shareholders&rsquo; meeting a proposal concerning the partial exemption of a director from liability,&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	ii.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: MIDDLE; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	consent to submit to the shareholders&rsquo;
	meeting a proposal concerning the modification of the articles of incorporation to provide that directors may be partially
	exempted from liability by the board of directors&rsquo; resolution,&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	iii.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: MIDDLE; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	consent to submit to the board of directors&rsquo;
	meeting a proposal concerning the partial exemption of a director from liability based on the provisions of the articles of
	incorporation, and&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	iv.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: MIDDLE; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	consent to submit to the shareholders&rsquo;
	meeting a proposal concerning the modification of the articles of incorporation to provide that the Company may enter into
	an agreement with an outside director for his/her partial exemption from liability.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -127.6PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 127.6PT">
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 42.75PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21PT">

	in case of urgent necessity
</TD>

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Article 22.&#9;(Consent to Participation in a Derivative Lawsuit)
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 49.65PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 14.15PT">
	1.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The consent of all auditors to the Company&rsquo;s participation in a derivative lawsuit to assist
	the defendant director(s) may be made through deliberations of the Board of Statutory Auditors.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 49.65PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 14.15PT">
	2.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The consent mentioned in the preceding paragraph may be made in writing or by electronic means
	in case of urgent necessity.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 63.8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Article 23.&#9;(Deliberation Regarding the Exercise of the Powers
	of Auditors)
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT">
	Auditors may, in the case of exercising their powers
	or fulfilling their obligations regarding the following items, have prior deliberations with the Board of Statutory Auditors:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT">
</P>
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; WIDTH: 12%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	i.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; WIDTH: 1%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: MIDDLE; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: 87%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	explanations of the questions
	for auditors notified by the shareholders via written documents prior to the shareholders&rsquo; meeting,&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	ii.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: MIDDLE; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	reports to the board of directors, demands
	to convene the board of directors, etc.,
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	iii.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: MIDDLE; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	results of investigations regarding
	the proposals, documents and others materials to be submitted to the shareholders&rsquo; meeting,&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	iv.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: MIDDLE; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	to seek injunctions against the acts
	of directors outside of the purpose of the Company or otherwise in violation of any law or regulation or the articles of incorporation,&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	v.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: MIDDLE; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	statements of opinion at a shareholders&rsquo;
	meeting regarding the election, dismissal, resignation, remuneration, etc. of auditors,&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	vi.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: MIDDLE; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	delivery of auditors&rsquo; opinions
	to shareholders in cases such as issuance of shares which includes transfer of control,
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	vii.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: MIDDLE; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	matters regarding lawsuits between the
	Company and the directors, and&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	viii.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: MIDDLE; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	matters regarding the filing of any
	lawsuits, etc.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Article 24.&#9;(Deliberation Regarding Remuneration, etc.)
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.2PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT">
	Auditors may deliberate on the remuneration,
	etc. of auditors with the consent of all auditors.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Article 25.&#9;(Authority of the Board of Statutory Auditors under
	the U.S. law)
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT">
	In accordance with the regulations, etc. of the SEC,
	the Board of Statutory Auditors shall have the authority mentioned below:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT">
</P>
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; WIDTH: 12%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	i.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; WIDTH: 1%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: MIDDLE; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: 87%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	to establish procedure for
	the receipt, retention and treatment of complains received by the Company
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	ii.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: MIDDLE; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	to engage independent counsel and other
	advisers necessary to carry out duties of the Board of Statutory Auditors
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	iii.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: MIDDLE; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	to allocate budgets necessary to carry
	out duties of the Board of Statutory Auditors
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	iv.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: MIDDLE; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	to grant approval, dismissal, and monitor
	regarding independent account auditors who are contracted with the Company in accordance with the relevant regulations by
	the SEC and also registered with the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (&quot;PCAOB&quot;) and are engaged in preparing
	audit reports, and other relevant audit activities, reviewing attesting services for the Company, to the extent permitted
	by laws of Japan.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	v.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: MIDDLE; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	to grant approval, regarding the duties
	of the Board of Statutory Auditors in line with &quot;Prior Approval Policies for Audit and Non-Audit Services&quot; which
	is prescribed separately, and&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	vi.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: MIDDLE; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	in addition to those set forth in the
	preceding paragraphs, conforming to the relevant regulations of the SEC to the extent permitted by laws of Japan.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Article 26.&#9;(Minutes)
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 42.55PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21PT">
	1.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Board of Statutory Auditors shall prepare containing the following items and all auditors present
	at the Board of Statutory Auditors meetings shall affix to the minutes their respective signatures or their respective names and
	seal impressions (including electronic signatures):
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -127.6PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 127.6PT">

</P>
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; WIDTH: 12%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	i.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; WIDTH: 1%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: MIDDLE; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: 87%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	the date and place of holding
	the Board of Statutory Auditors&rsquo; meeting (including the methods of attendance, in cases where auditors, directors or
	the independent account auditor attend such meeting without being physically present),
</FONT>
</TD>

<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">

<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

</FONT>
</TD>

	of the meeting and the results thereof,&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>

</FONT>

<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: MIDDLE; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	if there are any opinions stated or
	statements made at the Board of Statutory Auditors meeting with respect to the following matter, the summary of the contents
	of such opinions or statements:&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -127.6PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 127.6PT">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -127.6PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 127.6PT">
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 127.1PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21PT">
	(1)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	reports from the directors that any fact likely to cause the Company significant damage has been
	found; or
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 127.1PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21PT">
	(2)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	reports from the independent account auditors that there exists, in connection with the directors&rsquo;
	performance of their duties, any misconduct or any material fact constituting a violation of any law or regulation or the articles
	of incorporation;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -127.6PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 127.6PT">
</P>
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; WIDTH: 12%">
	iv.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; WIDTH: 1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: MIDDLE; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: 87%">
	names of the directors or the independent account auditors who attended the Board of Statutory Auditors meeting, and
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
	v.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: MIDDLE; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	the name of the chairperson of the Board of Statutory Auditors&rsquo; meeting
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -127.6PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 127.6PT">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -127.6PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 127.6PT">
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 42.55PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21PT">
	2.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	In cases where the report to the Board of Statutory Auditors shall not be required pursuant to
	Article 15, the Board of Statutory Auditors shall prepare minutes containing the following items:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -127.6PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 127.6PT">
</P>
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; WIDTH: 12%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	i.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; WIDTH: 1%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: MIDDLE; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: 87%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	contents of the matters
	which shall not be required to be reported to the Board of Statutory Auditors,&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	ii.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: MIDDLE; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	date on which the report to the Board
	of Statutory Auditors was deemed not to be required,&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	iii.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: MIDDLE; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	the name of the auditors who performed
	the duties concerning the preparation of the minutes.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -127.6PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 127.6PT">
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 42.55PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21PT">
	3.
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The minutes of the preceding two paragraphs shall be maintained for ten years.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Article 27. &#9;(Administration Office for Auditors)
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.2PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT">
	The affairs related to convening
	the Board of Statutory Auditors&rsquo; meetings, the preparation of the minutes of such meetings, and other affairs concerning
	the operation of the Board of Statutory Auditors shall be performed by employees who support auditors&rsquo; duties, such as staff
	for auditors.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Article 28.&#9;(Standards for the Audit of Statutory Auditors)
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.2PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT">
	Matters concerning the Board of
	Statutory Auditors and the audits by the Board of Statutory Auditors shall be governed by laws or the Articles of Incorporation
	or rules, these Regulations and auditing standards prescribed by the Board of Statutory Auditors.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Article 29.&#9;(Amendment and Abolition)
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.2PT; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 42.55PT">
	Any amendment and abolition of these
	Regulations shall be subject to the resolution of the Board of the Statutory Auditors. However, regarding Article 25 which regulates
	the authority given to the Board of the Statutory Auditors by the relevant regulations by the SEC shall be subject to the both
	resolution of the Board of the Statutory Auditors and the Board of Directors.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	- End -
</P>
</EFX_AUDITORS_OPINION>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0">
</P>
</EFX_EXHIBIT_1>

</B>

<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0">
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0">

<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	CERTIFICATIONS
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	I, Koichi Suzuki, certify that:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN">
	1.
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	I have reviewed this annual report on Form 20-F of Internet Initiative Japan Inc.;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN">
	2.
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Based on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or
	omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of the circumstances under which such statements
	were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this report;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN">
	3.
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Based on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included in
	this report, fairly present in all material respects the financial condition, results of operations and cash flows of the company
	as of, and for, the periods presented in this report;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN">
	4.
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The company&rsquo;s other certifying officer(s) and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining
	disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e)) and internal control over financial
	reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(f) and 15d-15(f)) for the company and have:
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Designed such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and procedures
	to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material information relating to the company, including its consolidated subsidiaries,
	is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this report is being prepared;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Designed such internal control over financial reporting, or caused such internal control over
	financial reporting to be designed under our supervision, to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial
	reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN">
	(c)
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Evaluated the effectiveness of the company&rsquo;s disclosure controls and procedures and presented
	in this report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the disclosure controls and procedures, as of the end of the period covered
	by this report based on such evaluation; and
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN">
	(d)
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Disclosed in this report any change in the company&rsquo;s internal control over financial reporting
	that occurred during the period covered by the annual report that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially
	affect, the company&rsquo;s internal control over financial reporting; and
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN">
	5.
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The company&rsquo;s other certifying officer(s) and I have disclosed, based on our most recent
	evaluation of internal control over financial reporting, to the company&rsquo;s auditors and the audit committee of the company&rsquo;s
	board of directors (or persons performing the equivalent functions):
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	All significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal control
	over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely affect the company&rsquo;s ability to record, process, summarize
	and report financial information; and
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.5IN">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Any fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who have a significant
	role in the company&rsquo;s internal control over financial reporting.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;

	Date: June 30, 2016

	disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e)) and internal control over financial

</FONT>

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
	(c)
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Evaluated the effectiveness of the company&rsquo;s disclosure controls and procedures and presented
	in this report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the disclosure controls and procedures, as of the end of the period covered
	by this report based on such evaluation; and
<BR>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
	(d)
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Disclosed in this report any change in the company&rsquo;s internal control over financial reporting
	that occurred during the period covered by the annual report that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially
	affect, the company&rsquo;s internal control over financial reporting; and
</FONT>
<BR>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
	5.
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The company&rsquo;s other certifying officer(s) and I have disclosed, based on our most recent
	evaluation of internal control over financial reporting, to the company&rsquo;s auditors and the audit committee of the company&rsquo;s
	board of directors (or persons performing the equivalent functions):
</FONT>
<BR>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	All significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal control
	over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely affect the company&rsquo;s ability to record, process, summarize
	and report financial information; and
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Any fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who have a significant
	role in the company&rsquo;s internal control over financial reporting.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0 0 12PT">
	Date: June 30, 2016
</P>

<EFX_EXHIBIT_13>
<A NAME="FIS_EXHIBIT_13"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; MARGIN: 0 0 0PT">
	Exhibit 13.1
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; MARGIN: 0 0 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; MARGIN: 0 0 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0 0 0PT">
	CERTIFICATIONS
<BR>
	Pursuant to Section 906 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002
<BR>
	(Subsections (a) and (b) of Section 1350, Chapter 63 of Title 18, United States Code)
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0 0 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0 0 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN: 0 0 12PT">
	Pursuant to 18 U.S.C. &sect; 1350, the undersigned officer of Internet
	Initiative Japan Inc. (the &ldquo;Company&rdquo;) hereby certifies, to such officer&rsquo;s knowledge, that the Company&rsquo;s
	annual report on Form 20-F for the year ended March 31, 2016 (the &ldquo;Report&rdquo;) fully complies with the requirements of
	Section 13(a) or 15(d), as applicable, of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 and that the information contained in the Report
	fairly presents, in all material respects, the financial condition and results of operations of the Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN: 0 0 12PT">
	Date: June 30, 2016
</P>

	CERTIFICATIONS
<BR>
	Pursuant to Section 906 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002
<BR>
	(Subsections (a) and (b) of Section 1350, Chapter 63 of Title 18, United States Code)
</P>

	&nbsp;

	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Pursuant to 18 U.S.C. &sect; 1350, the undersigned officer of Internet
	Initiative Japan Inc. (the &ldquo;Company&rdquo;) hereby certifies, to such officer&rsquo;s knowledge, that the Company&rsquo;s
	annual report on Form 20-F for the year ended March 31, 2016 (the &ldquo;Report&rdquo;) fully complies with the requirements of
	Section 13(a) or 15(d), as applicable, of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 and that the information contained in the Report
	fairly presents, in all material respects, the financial condition and results of operations of the Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
